programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen
programme.desc: This week, Saturday Kitchen is hosted by Matt Tebbutt, and he's joined by chefs Nathan Outlaw and Alison Roman. Plus, great moments from the BBC food archive, including clips from Rick Stein, Marcus Wareing, Nigella Lawson and Keith Floyd. This week, drinks expert Helen McGinn is picking the wines to go with the studio dishes.

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking S1 (6/6)
programme.desc: Easy celebration bakes, from a meringue layer cake to a seafood extravaganza.

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott previews the weekend's matches, including Arsenal v West Ham United.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Afternoon Session, Part 1
programme.desc: Live coverage from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad with all the results, reports and reaction from the afternoon's big games.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind S17
programme.desc: Clive Myrie asks the questions in another episode of the classic quiz, where celebrities donate to their chosen charities. Dr Hilary Jones, TV presenter Danni Menzies, drag queen Kitty Scott-Claus and actor Niamh McGrady are in the famous black chair tonight answering questions on the discovery of penicillin, rally driver Rosemary Smith, Girls Aloud and Bluey.

programme.title: The Weakest Link S2
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts as daytime TV stars Fern Britton, Owain Wyn Evans, Naga Munchetty, Charlie Stayt, Mr Motivator, Carol McGiffin, Diarmuid Gavin and Dr Punam Krishan try to win £50,000 for charity.

programme.title: Blankety Blank S1
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Adjoa Andoh, Martine McCutcheon, Johnny Vegas, Jimmy Carr, Chizzy Akudolu and Joe Swash try to fill in the missing blanks and help the contestants win some famous prizes.

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: A celebrity special edition of the general knowledge quiz in which four teams try to come up with the answers that no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman. Featuring Mari Wilson, Jaki Graham, Ruthie Henshall, Kerry Ellis, Carrie Grant, David Grant, Nicola Stephenson and Charlie Condou.

programme.title: Casualty (Pride and Prejudice) S37 (n°27)
programme.desc: «Pride and Prejudice»A difficult patient brings back a past Jan would rather forget.

programme.title: Comptine mortelle S1 (3/6)
programme.desc: CityWorld need to know if Susan wants to be CEO, but Andreas wants to go back to Crete.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces highlights and analysis of seven Premier League games, including title-chasing Manchester City's clash with relegation-threatened Leicester. The defending champions are locked in a two-way battle for the title with Arsenal, while the visitors are enduring a difficult campaign at the wrong end of the table under manager Brendan Rodgers. Elsewhere, Southampton host Crystal Palace in another fight for survival, while Everton continue their own quest to stay up against Fulham, who are managed by former Toffees boss Marco Silva.

programme.title: Greatest French Premier League Players
programme.desc: Gary Lineker and guests discuss the greatest French players to grace the top flight.
